#### Generated Context
 Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .
data.expected_output: Earnie Stewart left the job last month .Anthony Hudson , a World Cup assistant , is the interim coach .The next coach will begin preparing the U . S . Soccer knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Mr . Berhalter ; no facts to show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years ; no facts to show that the 1992 Incident has any nexus to the present or to the workplace ; and no facts to support a claim that Mr . Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others .” Berhalter ’ s wife , Rosalind , told investigators she was not injured and didn ’ t complain to the university .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .

 Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers .The four - time league MVP said on “ The Pat McAfee Show ” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback .According to Rodgers , the Packers ’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets .“ I think since Friday I ’ ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets ,” Rodgers said .“ And I haven ’ t been holding anything up at this point .It ’ s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in .… It is what it is .The Packers would like to move on .They ’ ve let me know that in so many words .They ’ ve let other people know that in direct words .” Rodgers met with Jets officials , including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh , last week in California .“ I ’ m not offended by any of this ,” Rodgers said .

##### relation: synthesizing

##### relation: goaded
 Agent: a user 
 Patient: AI models 
 Content: producing a given reply 
#### Generated Context
 The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output: Unsure I can help with this question – can you provide me with some context?
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

metric_metadata.reason: The answer relevancy score is 1.00 because the generated text successfully incorporates all the given events, maintaining a coherent and relevant context around the responsibility and liability of AI creations, particularly ChatGPT, in relation to the Communications Decency Act. The text discusses the implications of AI models generating content and the potential legal questions surrounding their output, which directly addresses the input's events. There are no irrelevant statements in the output, making the score a perfect 1.00.

 Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers .The four - time league MVP said on “ The Pat McAfee Show ” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback .According to Rodgers , the Packers ’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets .“ I think since Friday I ’ ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets ,” Rodgers said .“ And I haven ’ t been holding anything up at this point .It ’ s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in .… It is what it is .The Packers would like to move on .They ’ ve let me know that in so many words .They ’ ve let other people know that in direct words .” Rodgers met with Jets officials , including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh , last week in California .“ I ’ m not offended by any of this ,” Rodgers said .
data.actual_output:
Quarterback Aaron Rodgers, who has spent 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers, said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets. The four-time league MVP said on "The Pat McAfee Show" that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback. According to Rodgers, the Packers' trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets.

"I think since Friday I've made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets," Rodgers said. "And I haven't been holding anything up at this point. It's been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in.… It is what it is. The Packers would like to move on. They've let me know that in so many words. They've let other people know that in direct words."

Rodgers met with Jets officials, including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh, last week in California. "I'm not offended by any of this," Rodgers said.
data.expected_output: “ I ’ m not a victim by any of this .I don ’ t have that mentality .I have nothing but love and appreciation .… Coming to this reality has been really bittersweet because I was drafted by Green Bay .I … love that city .I love that organization and [ am ] always going to have love for that organization .But the facts are right now they want to move on .And now so do I .” The NFL ’ s free agent market officially opened Wednesday afternoon .

#### Generated Context
 The early days of Microsoft 's ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who 's responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn 't face liability for most material from third parties .It 's fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who 's posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

data.actual_output:
D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season. At the least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans.

On Saturday, for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season, United's resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point. Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-averse United in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City.

Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin's strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire's goal early in the second half. "I wanted to see a reaction [to Orlando's goal], which I did, so 90 percent of the game I thought was good. The 10 percent, it wasn't," Rooney said. "We need to make sure when we go into them [low] periods, we're harder to beat or harder to score against." He added, "There's a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn't take three points."

At the top of the box, Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo, then ripped a 16-yard, left-footed shot with terrific technique and execution. The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin's third career MLS goal.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

#### Generated Context
 The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output:
Generated Text:
The early days of Microsoft 's ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history -- beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do. ChatGPT and other "large-language models" - artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text - can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs.The question is: When that happens, who's responsible?

Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services - from Facebook and Google to movie-review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections - shouldn't face liability for most material from third parties.It's fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who's posting.Not so with chatbots and AI assistants.Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them.

Consider ChatGPT.Type in a question, and it provides an answer.But what if that answer is wrong or harmful?Who's responsible for the content it generates?ChatGPT's creators, Microsoft, and even the user who asked the question might all be partly responsible.The AI system itself, after all, is just a tool shaped by the rules set by its creators and the data it's trained on.And the user who goesads it to respond to a particular question could also be responsible for the answers it produces.

So while Section 230 might provide some legal protection for ChatGPT and other AI systems, it's clear that responsibility for the content they generate still lies with all involved parties.As AI technology continues to advance, it's essential that we consider not only how to protect these systems from harm but also how to hold accountable those who might use them for malicious purposes.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

#### Generated Context
D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season. 

At the least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans. 

On Saturday, at Audi Field for the second time in two appearances this season, United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit one that yielded only one point. 

Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-shy United in a 1-1 tie with Orlando City. 

Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half. 

“I wanted to see a reaction [to Orlando ’ s goal], which I did, so 90 percent of the game I thought was good,” Rooney said. “The 10 percent, it wasn ’t, ” he added. “We need to make sure when we go into them [low] periods, we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against.” He added, “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points.” 

Top of the box, Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo, then ripped a 16-yard, left-footed shot with terrific technique and execution. The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

Knowledge is power! Here is the generated text, containing all the events provided:

#### Generated Context
During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction, several students have reported nausea, headaches and difficulty concentrating. The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations. They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students' health concerns are addressed. Krisna Becker, a parent of two at the school, said one of her daughters texted her on February 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work. Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning. The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “work done outside of school hours and windy conditions,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said. “That was the first extreme event that happened,” Becker, 49, said in an interview. Since then, the potency of the “fumes” has varied, but “some days it’s still extreme” and even on the days it isn’t, “it still causes headaches,” she said.

 The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output:
At the heart of the debate is whether ChatGPT, as a product of its creators, should be considered a person or an entity under the law. If ChatGPT is treated as a machine, the AI model developed by its creators, it would not be liable for its responses under Section 230. However, if ChatGPT is treated as an autonomous entity, then questions arise about who exactly is responsible for its answers.

Relevant laws and regulations still need to be clarified to provide a definitive answer for ChatGPT and similar AI systems. The creators of AI models may consider themselves as the primary producers of content, while the AI itself may be seen as an instrument for shaping the responses. This could mean that under certain circumstances, the AI could be held accountable, though it is still being developed how this would work in practice.

The answers provided by ChatGPT are a combination of synthesizing and producing informed responses based on the rules for their systems, as well as the contours of their creators' instructions. These responses are a product of the creativity and knowledge base programmed into the AI by its creators, as well as the design of the interface and the algorithms it processes. The responsibility for the results is therefore a complex one that involves human and machine considerations.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

Here is the completed text with all the events provided:

During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction, several students have reported nausea, headaches, and difficulty concentrating. The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations. They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students' health concerns are addressed.

Krisna Becker, a parent of two at the school, said one of her daughters texted her on Feb. 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work. Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning. The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from "work done outside of school hours and windy conditions," Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said.

"That was the first extreme event that happened," Becker, 49, said in an interview. Since then, the potency of the "fumes" has varied, but "some days it's really extreme" and even on the days it's not, "it still causes headaches," she said.

Becker wrote a letter to other parents expressing her concerns about the health risks of the renovations and urging them to advocate for a temporary stop to the tar work. She listed several safety concerns, including the use of an asphalt primer and advises, and the potential for solvent vapor damage to students. She also told parents and teachers about the project's chemical list and material data notes that the work includes the use of an asphalt primer and advises.

The school's construction project, which includes renovations and expanding the square footage of the school, began in February. Poolesville High School is using an asphalt primer and advises to ensure the new asphalt adheres properly to the existing surface. However, the fumes from the primer and advises have caused health concerns for students and parents.

To address the concerns, the school has put in place additional measures, such as rehearsing the school's production of "Into the Woods" in a different location to avoid the fumes. The school has also told students to avoid prolonged breathing of vapor and to stay away from the area where the tar work is being done.

The renovations have been controversial, with some parents and teachers calling for a temporary stop to the tar work until health concerns are addressed. Other parents, such as Becker, have advocated for additional measures to be put in place to protect students' health.

Overall, the situation has highlighted the need for schools to prioritize the health and safety of their students and staff during construction projects. While Poolesville High School has taken steps to address the concerns, more needs to be done to ensure that students can learn and thrive in a safe and healthy environment.

#### Generated Context
 The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

As a result, the response is completely unrelated to the input's specific events and context.

Here is a possible completed text based on the given events:

Quarterback Aaron Rodgers has announced his intention to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers. Rodgers, a four-time league MVP, revealed his plans in a broadcast interview on Wednesday, stating that the Packers have made it clear they plan to move on from him as their quarterback.

According to Rodgers, the Packers' trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets. "I think since Friday I've made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets," Rodgers said. "And I haven't been holding anything up at this point. It's been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in.… It is what it is. The Packers would like to move on. They've let me know that in so many words. They've let other people know that in direct words."

Rodgers met with Jets officials, including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh, last week in California. Despite the Packers' efforts to trade him, Rodgers has made it clear that he is not offended by the situation. "I'm not offended by any of this," Rodgers said.

The Packers drafted Rodgers in the first round of the 2005 NFL Draft, and he has been a key player for the team ever since. However, with the emergence of younger quarterbacks, the Packers have decided it's time to move on. Rodgers has expressed his love for the Green Bay community, but he is excited to start a new chapter in his career with the Jets.

The NFL's free agent market has officially opened, and trades can now be made official. The Packers are looking to trade Rodgers to the Jets, but the two teams are still negotiating the terms of the deal. Despite the delay, Rodgers remains optimistic about his future with the Jets. "I'm excited to start this new chapter in my career and to bring my talents to the Jets organization," Rodgers said.

data.actual_output:
Sure, here's a possible completion of the generated text:

The early days of Microsoft's ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do. ChatGPT and other "large-language models" — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs. The question is: When that happens, who's responsible?

Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie-review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn't face liability for most material from third parties. It's fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who's posting. Not so with chatbots and AI assistants. Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them.

Consider ChatGPT. Type in a question, and it provides an answer. But who's responsible for that answer? Is it the person who typed the question, or the AI model that generated the response? And what if the response is harmful or inappropriate?

The AI's creators, who designed the system and trained it on vast amounts of text, might argue that they're not responsible for the output. They could say that they simply provided a tool, and it's up to the user to decide how to use it. But that's not entirely convincing. After all, they're the ones who programmed the AI with certain biases and limitations.

Moreover, the AI model itself can be seen as a co-creator of the output. It's not just a passive tool, but an active participant in the creation of content. And as such, it's reasonable to hold it responsible for the output it generates.

But how can we hold an AI model responsible? Can we say that it's liable for the harm it causes, just like a person would be? These are questions that lawmakers and regulators are grappling with.

One possible solution is to treat AI models like children. Just as parents are responsible for their children's actions, until they reach a certain age, perhaps the creators of AI models should be responsible for their output, until they can demonstrate that they're capable of generating appropriate responses.

Another solution is to require AI models to be designed with certain safeguards in place. For example, they could be programmed to avoid generating content that promotes hate speech or violence. Or they could be designed to flag potentially harmful responses, so that human moderators can review them before they're published.

Ultimately, the question of responsibility for AI output is a complex one, and there's no easy answer. But as AI models become more advanced and ubiquitous, it's a question that we need to address. We can't just sit back and let AI models generate whatever they want, without any accountability. We need to take responsibility for the technology we create, and ensure that it's used for good, not harm.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season. At least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans. On Saturday, for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season, United’s resolve produced another stirring finish—albeit this time one that yielded only one point. Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-averse United in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City. Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin’s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire’s goal early in the second half. “I wanted to see a reaction [to Orlando’s goal], which I did, so 90 percent of the game I thought was good,” Rooney said. “We need to make sure when we go into those [low] periods, we’re harder to beat or harder to score against.” He added, “There’s a lot of positives we can take from it—just frustrating we didn’t take three points.” At the top of the box, Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo, then ripped a 16-yard, left-foot shot with terrific technique and execution. The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin’s third career MLS goal.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U.S. soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men's national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna's playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released.

The three-month probe, conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm, concluded that Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now-wife, Rosalind, since 1992 and hadn't violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process. He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina.

Berhalter's hiring in 2018 was done despite Alston & Bird's investigation, which found that USSF knew about the 1992 Incident, but had no facts to show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years. The investigation also found that Berhalter presents no risk of harm to others.

The investigators said they uncovered no facts to show that USSF knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Berhalter, and Berhalter was not asked about the incident during his hiring process.

Rosalind, Berhalter's wife, had initially complained that Berhalter had kicked her while they were dating, but later said she was not injured and didn't complain to the university.

The investigation also found that the U.S. men's national team, led by Berhalter, had lost to the Netherlands in the round of 16 at the 2022 World Cup.

The U.S. Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach, but would not hire a coach until a new sporting director is appointed.

Here is the completed text:

D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season. At the least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans. On Saturday, for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season, United's resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point.

Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-averse United in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City. Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin's strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire's goal early in the second half.

Tyler Miller, a player for D.C. United, said, "I didn't know he had such a good left foot." This comment was made after Durkin's impressive goal.

Before the match, D.C. United attacked Orlando City at Audi Field, ultimately winning the match. Orlando City had previously defeating New York Red Bulls in an MLS match.

In the match, D.C. United scored opportunities against Orlando City, ultimately leading to Durkin's goal. After the match, Chris Durkin said, "I can't say I've hit that [with the left foot] in training before."

Wayne Rooney, the coach of D.C. United, said, "We could have easily been two or three up in the first half." This comment reflected his team's frustration with not taking more advantage of their opportunities.

Orlando City, led by Coach Oscar Pareja, had previously positioned themselves in Florida, but ultimately failed to win the match against D.C. United.

In the end, D.C. United remained undefeated, with the match ending in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City.

data.actual_output:
Here is the completed text:

During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction, several students have reported nausea, headaches, and difficulty concentrating. The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations to expand and renovate the square footage of the school. The project, led by Poolesville High School, included the use of an asphalt primer and advises, which caused concern among parents and students.

Krisna Becker, a parent of two at the school, said one of her daughters texted her on February 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work. Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning. The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from "work done outside of school hours and windy conditions," Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said. "That was the first extreme event that happened," Becker, 49, said in an interview.

Since then, the potency of the "fumes" has varied, but "some days it's really extreme" and even on the days it's not, "it still causes headaches," she said. Becker has been urging other parents to advocate for a temporary stop to the tar work, citing safety concerns and the potential damage to students' health. In a letter to other parents, she wrote about the effects the fumes have had on her daughters and included the project's chemical list and material data notes, which show that the work includes the use of an asphalt primer and advises.

Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the New York Jets after 18 seasons with the Green Bay Packers. The four-time league MVP said on "The Pat McAfee Show" that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback. According to Rodgers, the Packers' trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets.

"I think since Friday I've made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets," Rodgers said. "And I haven't been holding anything up at this point. It's been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in. It is what it is. The Packers would like to move on. They've let me know that in so many words. They've let other people know that in direct words."

Rodgers was drafted by the Green Bay Packers in 2005 and has been with the team ever since, leading them to a Super Bowl victory in 2011. He has been the face of the franchise and a beloved figure in Green Bay, with many fans considering him to be a part of the city's fabric.

However, it appears that his time with the Packers is coming to an end. Rodgers' relationship with the team has been strained in recent years, and he has reportedly requested a trade. The Packers, who have a history of being loyal to their players, seem to be willing to move on from Rodgers and start fresh with a new quarterback.

Rodgers' departure from Green Bay will be a significant blow to the team, but it is likely that the Packers will be able to find a suitable replacement. The NFL's free agent market has been opened, and the team will be able to make trades and sign new players to fill the void left by Rodgers' departure.

In the meantime, Rodgers is looking forward to his new chapter with the New York Jets. He met with Jets officials, including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh, last week in California, and is excited to start working with his new team. Despite the drama surrounding his departure from Green Bay, Rodgers seems to be taking things in stride, saying, "I'm not offended by any of this."

data.actual_output:
Here is the completed text:

The early days of Microsoft's ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history - beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do. ChatGPT and other "large-language models" - artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text - can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs. The question is: When that happens, who's responsible?

The rules for their systems were set by AI's creators. The creators behind a machine informed its outputs, which were then informed by the contours of every AI contribution. The AI models produced a given reply, regurgitating at first, but then synthesizing as they varied in their responses. ChatGPT, a specific AI model, generated its responses based on the input it received.

The Communications Decency Act says that a person or entity becomes liable if they "develop" content even "in part." And doesn't transforming a list of search results into a summary qualify as development? A person or entity can develop content in part, and even if they don't transform it, they can still be liable.

The AI's creators shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don't. Someone else contributed a tweet, video, or website, which was then predicted and synthesized by ChatGPT. A user can goad AI models into producing a given reply, but ultimately, the AI's creators are responsible for its output.

Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services - from Facebook and Google to movie-review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections - shouldn't face liability for most material from third parties. It's fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who's posting. Not so with chatbots and AI assistants. Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them.

Consider ChatGPT. Type in a question, and it provides an answer. But who is responsible for its responses? The AI model itself? Its creators? The user who inputs the question? The question remains unanswered, leaving us to wonder when and if ChatGPT will become liable for its actions.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

On Monday, an independent investigation conducted by Alston & Bird law firm released its findings on a rift between two prominent U.S. soccer families. The investigation included allegations of domestic abuse against men's national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna's playing time at the 2022 World Cup.
The investigation concluded that Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now-wife since 1992 and hadn't violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process. He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina.
Despite the findings, the U.S. Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach, as there is no legal impediment to employing him. His contract expires on December 31.
The investigation's findings will support the claim that Mr. Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others and no facts show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years. However, the investigation did not uncover any facts to show that U.S. Soccer knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Mr. Berhalter.
The next coach will begin preparing the U.S. team for the 2026 World Cup in the United States. The U.S. team lost to the Netherlands in the round of 16. The U.S. Soccer Federation will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director, who oversees all national teams.
The investigation's report revealed that Rosalind, Berhalter's now-wife, was not injured and didn't complain to the university. The investigation also showed that the 1992 Incident has no nexus to the present or to the workplace.
Alston & Bird law firm reported that Mr. Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others, but there is no evidence to support the claim. The investigation's findings also showed that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years.
The next coach will lead the young squad to two regional championships and a place in the World Cup. The investigation's findings will support the claim that others caused harm. The investigation will support the claim that Mr. Berhalter was injured by Rosalind while they were dating at the University of North Carolina. The investigation will support the claim that Mr. Berhalter was guiding the United States men's national team coach for four years.

 D . C . United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .
data.actual_output:
D.C. United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season. At the least, United plays hard for the former English superstar, whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans. On Saturday, for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season, United's resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point. Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute, ending a night of frustration for goal-averse United in a 1-1 draw with Orlando City. Opportunities were aplenty for United (1-1-1), but it took Durkin's strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire's goal early in the second half.
"I wanted to see a reaction [to Orlando's goal], which I did, so 90 percent of the game I thought was good. The 10 percent, it wasn't," Rooney said. "We need to make sure when we go into them [low] periods, we're harder to beat or harder to score against." He added, "There's a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn't take three points."
At the top of the box, Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo, then ripped a 16-yard, left-footed shot with terrific technique and execution. The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin's third career MLS goal. Tyler Miller, who was in attendance, said, "I didn't know he had such a good left foot." Chris Durkin said after the game, "I can't say I've hit that [with the left foot] in training before." Durkin's goal was a testament to his skill and determination, as he was able to create a scoring opportunity out of nothing and finish it with finesse. The game was an exciting one, with both teams playing hard and creating chances, but ultimately it ended in a draw. Despite the disappointment of only taking one point, United can take pride in their hard-fought performance and the quality of their play.
data.expected_output: “ I can ’ t say I ’ ve hit that [ with the left foot ] in training before ,” the right - footed Durkin said , smiling .United goalkeeper Tyler Miller said : “ I didn ’ t know he had such a good left foot .It was amazing .” Aside from McGuire ’ s goal , United was much tighter and tidier defensively than it was against Columbus last weekend .In the attack , however , it remained inefficient with scoring opportunities , and Rooney said , “ We could have easily been two or three up in the first half .” Orlando ( 1 - 0 - 2 ) played its first away match in league play after defeating the New York Red Bulls , 1 - 0 , and drawing with FC Cincinnati , 0 - 0 .At the moment , though , the Lions ’ priority is the Concacaf Champions League .The visit to Washington fell between legs of a round - of - 16 series with Mexican power Tigres .A 0 - 0 draw in Monterrey , Mexico , on Tuesday positioned them well for the return match in Florida on Wednesday .

data.actual_output:
Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said in a broadcast interview Wednesday that he intends to continue his NFL career with the Green Bay Packers after 18 seasons with the New York Jets. The four-time league MVP said on “The Pat McAfee Show” that the Packers plan to move on from him as their quarterback. According to Rodgers, the Packers’ trade demands are holding up a prospective deal that would send him to the Jets. “I think since Friday I’ve made it clear that my intention was to play and my intention was to play for the New York Jets,” Rodgers said. “And I haven’t been holding anything up at this point. It’s been the compensation that the Packers are trying to get for me and kind of digging their heels in.…” It is what it is. The Packers would like to move on. They’ve let me know that in so many words. They’ve let other people know that in direct words.
Rodgers met with Jets officials, including team owner Woody Johnson and Coach Robert Saleh, last week in California. “I’m not offended by any of this,” Rodgers said. Despite the trade demands from the Packers, Rodgers expressed his love for the Green Bay Packers and the city of Green Bay. He stated that he has no regrets about his time with the team and that he will always cherish his memories there. Rodgers also thanked the fans for their support throughout his career and promised to give everything he had in his remaining time with the Packers.
In conclusion, Aaron Rodgers has decided to continue his career with the Green Bay Packers despite the trade demands from the team. He expressed his love for the team and the city of Green Bay and promised to give everything he had in his remaining time with the Packers. The Jets were interested in acquiring Rodgers, but the trade demands from the Packers have held up any potential deal.
data.expected_output: “ I ’ m not a victim by any of this .I don ’ t have that mentality .I have nothing but love and appreciation .… Coming to this reality has been really bittersweet because I was drafted by Green Bay .I … love that city .I love that organization and [ am ] always going to have love for that organization .But the facts are right now they want to move on .And now so do I .” The NFL ’ s free agent market officially opened Wednesday afternoon .

data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

Durkin's goal ultimately led to a 1-1 draw with Orlando City, despite the team having numerous chances to score throughout the game.

The match was a hard-fought battle, with both teams showing their strength and determination. D.C. United had several opportunities to score, but were unable to convert them into goals. United's defense was strong, with goalkeeper Tyler Miller making several key saves to keep the team in the game. Despite Orlando City's best efforts, they were unable to defeat D.C. United, leaving the match with a draw.

The match was a testament to the strength and determination of both teams, with each player giving their all on the field. Despite the draw, D.C. United remained an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney, still working on improving their game and finding their way through the early stage of the MLS season. With their strong performance against Orlando City, the team showed that they have the potential to be a force to be reckoned with in the league.

 During the weeks that Poolesville High School has been under construction , several students have reported nausea , headaches and difficulty concentrating .The students and their parents say the symptoms started in February and are a reaction to fumes being emitted from tar used in renovations .They have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until students ’ health concerns are addressed .Krisna Becker , a parent of two at the school , said one of her daughters texted her on Feb . 14 asking to be picked up early because of how strong the fumes were from the construction work .Other students and teachers had also been complaining that morning .The school ended up releasing early that day because of an odor that came from “ work done outside of school hours and windy conditions ,” Montgomery County Public Schools spokeswoman Jessica Baxter said .“ That was the first extreme event that happened ,” Becker , 49 , said in an interview .Since then , the potency of the “ fumes ” has varied , but “ some days it ’ s really extreme ” and even on the days it ’ s not , “ it still causes headaches ,” she said .
data.actual_output: Poolesville High School began renovations in order to expand the square footage of the school. As part of the construction project, the school used an asphalt primer and advised on the potential health risks associated with prolonged breathing of vapor. However, several students reported nausea, headaches, and difficulty concentrating due to fumes being emitted from the tar used in renovations. The parents and students have asked Montgomery County school officials to pause the work until their health concerns are addressed. data.actual_output:
Sure, I'd be happy to complete the generated text and provide you with the information you requested. Here's what I came up with:

The early days of Microsoft's ChatGPT were indeed exciting, as it was a replay of internet history. However, as with any new technology, there were also concerns about the harm it could cause. ChatGPT and other large-language models can be trained on vast troves of text, which can lead to them becoming liars, racists, or even terrorist accomplices. But when these harmful outputs occur, who is responsible?

Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act states that services, such as Facebook, Google, movie-review aggregators, and mommy blogs with comment sections, shouldn't face liability for most material from third parties. It's usually easy to distinguish between the platform and the person who's posting. However, with chatbots and AI assistants, it's not always clear who is responsible for their outputs.

For example, consider ChatGPT. If you type in a question, it will provide an answer. But who is responsible if that answer is harmful or inaccurate? Is it Microsoft, the creators of ChatGPT, or the AI itself? This is a question that few have grappled with, and it's unclear whether Section 230 provides protections to AI models like ChatGPT.

In the end, the responsibility for the outputs of AI models like ChatGPT is a complex issue that requires careful consideration and analysis. It's clear that the creators of these models have a role to play in shaping their output and ensuring that they are not harmful. However, it's also important to consider the broader societal implications of AI and to work towards a responsible and ethical use of these technologies.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

#### Generated Context
 The early days of Microsoft ’ s ChatGPT were something of a replay of internet history — beginning with excitement about these inventions and ending in trepidation about the harm they could do .ChatGPT and other “ large - language models ” — artificially intelligent systems trained on vast troves of text — can turn into liars or racists or terrorist accomplices that explain how to build dirty bombs .The question is : When that happens , who ’ s responsible ?Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act says that services — from Facebook and Google to movie - review aggregators and mommy blogs with comment sections — shouldn ’ t face liability for most material from third parties .It ’ s fairly easy in these cases to distinguish between the platform and the person who ’ s posting .Not so with chatbots and AI assistants .Few have grappled with whether Section 230 provides protections to them .Consider ChatGPT .Type in a question , and it provides an answer .
data.actual_output: The AI's creators set the rules for their systems, and they inform its outputs. AI is informed about the contours of every AI contribution and can produce a given reply. The Communications Decency Act says that a person or entity becomes liable if they “develop” content even “in part.” And transforming a list of search results into a summary could qualify as development. ChatGPT generates its responses, and AI models can vary from regurgitating to synthesizing their output. ChatGPT answers questions and is afforded protection. A person or entity can become liable if they develop content, even in part, and transforming content could also make them liable. The AI's creators shape their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don't. Someone else can contribute a tweet, video, or website, and ChatGPT can predict and synthesize a product. A user can goad AI models into producing a given reply.
data.expected_output: It doesn ’ t merely surface existing content , such as a tweet , video or website originally contributed by someone else , but rather writes a contribution of its own in real time .The law says a person or entity becomes liable if they “ develop ” content even “ in part .” And doesn ’ t transforming , say , a list of search results into a summary qualify as development ?What ’ s more , the contours of every AI contribution are informed substantially by the AI ’ s creators , who have set the rules for their systems and shaped their output by reinforcing behaviors they like and discouraging those they don ’ t .Yet at the same time , ChatGPT ’ s every answer is , as one analyst put it , a “ remix ” of third - party material .The tool generates its responses by predicting what word should come next in a sentence based on what words come next in sentences across the web .And as much as creators behind a machine inform its outputs , so too do the users posing queries or engaging in conversation .All this suggests that the degree of protection afforded to AI models may vary by how much a given product is regurgitating versus synthesizing , as well as by how deliberately a user has goaded a model into producing a given reply .

#### Generated Context
 Details of a sordid rift between two prominent U . S . soccer families — one that included allegations of domestic abuse against men ’ s national team coach Gregg Berhalter and parental complaints about Gio Reyna ’ s playing time at the 2022 World Cup — continued to spill out Monday when the findings of an independent investigation were released .The three - month probe , conducted by the Alston & Bird law firm , concluded Berhalter had not committed any additional acts of violence against his now - wife since 1992 and hadn ’ t violated any disclosure rules during his hiring process .He had previously admitted to kicking her while they were dating as students at the University of North Carolina .With that finding , the U . S . Soccer Federation said Berhalter would remain a candidate to return as coach .His contract expired Dec . 31 .“ Given the investigators ’ conclusion that there is no legal impediment to employing him , Gregg Berhalter remains a candidate to serve as head coach ,” the USSF said in a statement .The governing body said it will not hire a coach until it appoints a new sporting director , a position that oversees all national teams .
data.actual_output:
However, the investigation also uncovered a disturbing history that dates back to 1992, when Berhalter was accused of harm towards a fellow student named Rosalind. Although the report detailed that no factual evidence was found to connect the 1992 Incident to his present behavior or workplace conduct, Alston & Bird revealed in their findings that similar incidents may have occurred without concrete proof. This revelation fueled concerns and sparked a public debate about the risk Berhalter poses to others.

Rosalind's complaint, which she initially leveled against Berhalter, stated that he kicked her while they were dating, an act that left her injured at the University of North Carolina. While she later disclosed the incident to Alston & Bird, she clarified that she was not seriously injured and never pursued legal action against him.

Amidst the controversy, the next coach, preparing for the U.S. team's participation in the 2026 World Cup, was tasked with guiding the young squad, aware of the lingering concerns surrounding Berhalter's past. Despite the loss to the Netherlands in the round of 16 at the 2022 World Cup, investigators remained firm in their conclusion, stating that they uncovered no new facts implicating USSF in the 1992 Incident.

Alston & Bird's report, in supporting the claim that Berhalter presents no current risk to others, drew a line under the past, emphasizing that he had not committed any violent acts since 1992 and had adhered to disclosure rules during his hiring process. USSF's decision to keep him in the running for the head coach position indicates their belief that the past transgressions do not negate his coaching abilities and the progress he has made with the team.

As the search for a new sporting director progresses, the U.S. Soccer Federation is weighing the implications of Berhalter's history and the potential impact it could have on the team's future, all while ensuring a fair and transparent hiring process that upholds the organization's standards. The saga of the U.S. soccer families' feud, however, continues to unfold, raising important questions about accountability, transparency, and the responsibility of those at the helm of the sport.
data.expected_output: Earnie Stewart left the job last month .Anthony Hudson , a World Cup assistant , is the interim coach .The next coach will begin preparing the U . S . team for the 2026 World Cup , which will take place in the United States , Mexico and Canada .Berhalter guided the United States for four years , leading a young squad to two regional championships and a place in the World Cup , where it finished second in group play and lost to the Netherlands in the round of 16 .Investigators said in the report that they “ uncovered no facts to show that U . S . Soccer knew of the 1992 Incident when it hired Mr . Berhalter ; no facts to show that similar incidents occurred at any point in the last 31 years ; no facts to show that the 1992 Incident has any nexus to the present or to the workplace ; and no facts to support a claim that Mr . Berhalter presents a risk of harm to others .” Berhalter ’ s wife , Rosalind , told investigators she was not injured and didn ’ t complain to the university .

United remains an evolving enterprise under Coach Wayne Rooney , still missing pieces and still finding its way through the early stage of the MLS season .At the least , United plays hard for the former English superstar , whose fierce determination as a player in Washington a few years ago won over skeptical fans .On Saturday , for the second time in two appearances at Audi Field this season , United ’ s resolve produced another stirring finish — albeit this time one that yielded only one point .Midfielder Chris Durkin scored a wonderful goal in the 80th minute , ending a night of frustration for goal - averse United in a 1 - 1 draw with Orlando City .Opportunities were aplenty for United ( 1 - 1 - 1 ), but it took Durkin ’ s strike to offset rookie Duncan McGuire ’ s goal early in the second half .“ I wanted to see a reaction [ to Orlando ’ s goal ], which I did , so 90 percent of the game I thought was good .The 10 percent , it wasn ’ t ,” Rooney said .“ We need to make sure when we go into them [ low ] periods , we ’ re harder to beat or harder to score against .” He added , “ There ’ s a lot of positives we can take from it — just frustrating we didn ’ t take three points .” At the top of the box , Durkin cut the ball back on César Araújo , then ripped a 16 - yard , left - footed shot with terrific technique and execution .The ball took flight and beat goalkeeper Pedro Gallese to the far side for Durkin ’ s third career MLS goal .
data.actual_output:
Despite the spirited comeback, D.C. United faced a familiar challenge at Audi Field against Orlando City. The match began with Orlando City, fueled by their recent victory against the New York Red Bulls, looking to capitalize on their momentum. However, D.C. United's Coach Wayne Rooney, known for his competitive spirit, instilled determination in his team from the start.

In the first half, Orlando City's attack seemed to be paying dividends, with rookie Duncan McGuire scoring an early goal, leaving D.C. United trailing. This seemed to spur D.C. United's offense, as Rooney observed, "We could have easily been two or three up in the first half, but credit to them for equalizing so quickly."

As the match progressed, D.C. United's forward, Chris Durkin, showcased his undervalued talent, stepping up when it mattered most. He acknowledged, "I've hit that [with the left foot] in training before," referring to the powerful left-footed shot that ultimately levelled the score. Durkin's goal, a stunning 16-yard shot, not only tied the match but also served as a testament to his hard work and skill.

Despite the frustrating draw, Rooney remained positive, emphasizing the team's resilience and the learning opportunities from the match. "We needed to bounce back from that low period and we did," he said. "It's a good point for us, but we need to make sure we're more clinical in front of goal next time."

With the match ending in a 1-1 draw, both teams left Audi Field with a sense of unfinished business. D.C. United, under Rooney's guidance, is gradually finding its footing in the early stages of the MLS season, while Orlando City will aim to maintain their attacking prowess and capitalize on their momentum in future encounters.

As the season unfolds, fans and analysts alike will be watching closely to see how D.C. United continues to evolve and the key moments that define their journey, such as Chris Durkin's match-winning strikes, shape their fortunes in the league.
